00070 /* Get periodic prints from idle loop, from clock seconds or rtimer interrupts */
00071 /* Use of rtimer will conflict with other rtimer interrupts such as contikimac radio cycling */
00072 #define PERIODICPRINTS 0
00073 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00074 //#define PINGS 64
00075 #define ROUTES 300
00076 #define STAMPS 60
00077 #define STACKMONITOR 600
00078 //#define HEAPMONITOR 60
00079 uint16_t clocktime;
00080 #define TESTRTIMER 0
00081 #if TESTRTIMER
00082 uint8_t rtimerflag=1;
00083 struct rtimer rt;
00084 void rtimercycle(void) {rtimerflag=1;}
00085 #endif
00086 #endif

00088 #define DEBUG 0
00089 #if DEBUG
00090 #include <stdio.h>
00091 #define PRINTF(...) printf(__VA_ARGS__)
00092 #define PRINT6ADDR(addr) PRINTF(" %02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x:%02x%02x ", ((u8_t *)addr)[0], ((u8_t *)addr)[1], ((u8_t *)addr)[2], ((u8_t *)addr)[3], ((u8_t *)addr)[4], ((u8_t *)addr)[5], ((u8_t *)addr)[6], ((u8_t *)addr)[7], ((u8_t *)addr)[8], ((u8_t *)addr)[9], ((u8_t *)addr)[10], ((u8_t *)addr)[11], ((u8_t *)addr)[12], ((u8_t *)addr)[13], ((u8_t *)addr)[14], ((u8_t *)addr)[15])
00093 #define PRINTLLADDR(lladdr) PRINTF(" %02x:%02x:%02x:%02x:%02x:%02x ",(lladdr)->addr[0], (lladdr)->addr[1], (lladdr)->addr[2], (lladdr)->addr[3],(lladdr)->addr[4], (lladdr)->addr[5])
00094 #else
00095 #define PRINTF(...)
00096 #define PRINT6ADDR(addr)
00097 #define PRINTLLADDR(addr)
00098 #endif

00151 #define RF_CHANNEL              26

00153 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00154 #if WITH_UIP
00155 static void
00156 set_gateway(void)
00157 {
00158   if(!is_gateway) {
00159     leds_on(LEDS_RED);
00160     printf("%d.%d: making myself the IP network gateway.\n\n",
00161            rimeaddr_node_addr.u8[0], rimeaddr_node_addr.u8[1]);
00162     printf("IPv4 address of the gateway: %d.%d.%d.%d\n\n",
00163            uip_ipaddr_to_quad(&uip_hostaddr));
00164     uip_over_mesh_set_gateway(&rimeaddr_node_addr);
00165     uip_over_mesh_make_announced_gateway();
00166     is_gateway = 1;
00167   }
00168 }
00169 #endif /* WITH_UIP */
00170 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00171 static void
00172 print_processes(struct process * const processes[])
00173 {
00174   /*  const struct process * const * p = processes;*/
00175   printf("Starting");
00176   while(*processes != NULL) {
00177     printf(" '%s'", (*processes)->name);
00178     processes++;
00179   }
00180   printf("\n");
00181 }

00186 void
00187 init_lowlevel(void)
00188 {
00189         /* button init */
00190         /* set up kbi */
00191         enable_irq_kbi(4);
00192         kbi_edge(4);
00193         enable_ext_wu(4);
00194 //      kbi_pol_neg(7);
00195 //      kbi_pol_pos(7);
00196 //      gpio_sel0_pullup(29);
00197 //      gpio_pu0_disable(29);
00198 
00199         trim_xtal();
00200         
00201         /* uart init */
00202         uart_init(BRINC, BRMOD, SAMP);
00203         
00204         default_vreg_init();
00205 
00206         maca_init();
00207 
00208         set_channel(RF_CHANNEL - 11); /* channel 11 */
00209         set_power(0x12); /* 0x12 is the highest, not documented */
00210 
00211         enable_irq(CRM);
00212 
00213 #if USE_32KHZ_XTAL
00214         enable_32khz_xtal();
00215 #else
00216         cal_ring_osc();
00217 #endif
00218 
00219 #if USE_32KHZ_XTAL
00220         *CRM_RTC_TIMEOUT = 32768 * 10; 
00221 #else 
00222         *CRM_RTC_TIMEOUT = cal_rtc_secs * 10;
00223 #endif
00224 
00225 #if (USE_WDT == 1)
00226         /* set the watchdog timer timeout to 1 sec */
00227         cop_timeout_ms(WDT_TIMEOUT);
00228         /* enable the watchdog timer */
00229         CRM->COP_CNTLbits.COP_EN = 1;
00230 #endif
00231 
00232         /* XXX debug */
00233         /* trigger periodic rtc int */
00234 //      clear_rtc_wu_evt();
00235 //      enable_rtc_wu();
00236 //      enable_rtc_wu_irq();
00237 }
00238 
00239 #if RIMEADDR_SIZE == 1
00240 const rimeaddr_t addr_ff = { { 0xff } };
00241 #else /*RIMEADDR_SIZE == 2*/
00242 #if RIMEADDR_SIZE == 2
00243 const rimeaddr_t addr_ff = { { 0xff, 0xff } };
00244 #else /*RIMEADDR_SIZE == 2*/
00245 #if RIMEADDR_SIZE == 8
00246 const rimeaddr_t addr_ff = { { 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff } };
00247 #endif /*RIMEADDR_SIZE == 8*/
00248 #endif /*RIMEADDR_SIZE == 2*/
00249 #endif /*RIMEADDR_SIZE == 1*/
00250 
00251 void iab_to_eui64(rimeaddr_t *eui64, uint32_t oui, uint16_t iab, uint32_t ext) {
00252         /* OUI for IABs */
00253         eui64->u8[0] =  0x00;
00254         eui64->u8[1] =  0x50;
00255         eui64->u8[2] =  0xc2;
00256 
00257         /* IAB */
00258         eui64->u8[3] = (iab >> 4)  & 0xff;
00259         eui64->u8[4] = (iab << 4) &  0xf0;
00260 
00261         /* EXT */
00262 
00263         eui64->u8[4] |= (ext >> 24) & 0xf;
00264         eui64->u8[5] = (ext >> 16) & 0xff;
00265         eui64->u8[6] = (ext >> 8)  & 0xff;
00266         eui64->u8[7] =  ext        & 0xff;
00267 }
00268 
00269 void oui_to_eui64(rimeaddr_t *eui64, uint32_t oui, uint64_t ext) {
00270         /* OUI */
00271         eui64->u8[0] = (oui >> 16) & 0xff;
00272         eui64->u8[1] = (oui >> 8)  & 0xff;
00273         eui64->u8[2] =  oui        & 0xff;
00274 
00275         /* EXT */
00276         eui64->u8[3] = (ext >> 32) & 0xff;
00277         eui64->u8[4] = (ext >> 24) & 0xff;
00278         eui64->u8[5] = (ext >> 16) & 0xff;
00279         eui64->u8[6] = (ext >> 8)  & 0xff;
00280         eui64->u8[7] =  ext        & 0xff;
00281 }
00282 
00283 void
00284 set_rimeaddr(rimeaddr_t *addr) 
00285 {
00286         nvmType_t type=0;
00287         nvmErr_t err;   
00288         volatile uint8_t buf[RIMEADDR_NBYTES];
00289         rimeaddr_t eui64;
00290         int i;
00291                 
00292         err = nvm_detect(gNvmInternalInterface_c, &type);
00293 
00294         err = nvm_read(gNvmInternalInterface_c, type, (uint8_t *)buf, RIMEADDR_NVM, RIMEADDR_NBYTES);
00295 
00296         rimeaddr_copy(addr,&rimeaddr_null);
00297 
00298         for(i=0; i<RIMEADDR_CONF_SIZE; i++) {           
00299                 addr->u8[i] = buf[i];
00300         }
00301 
00302         if (memcmp(addr, &addr_ff, RIMEADDR_CONF_SIZE)==0) {
00303 
00304                 //set addr to EUI64
00305 #ifdef IAB              
00306    #ifdef EXT_ID
00307                 PRINTF("address in flash blank, setting to defined IAB and extension.\n\r");
00308                 iab_to_eui64(&eui64, OUI, IAB, EXT_ID);
00309    #else  /* ifdef EXT_ID */
00310                 PRINTF("address in flash blank, setting to defined IAB with a random extension.\n\r");
00311                 iab_to_eui64(&eui64, OUI, IAB, *MACA_RANDOM);
00312    #endif /* ifdef EXT_ID */
00313 
00314 #else  /* ifdef IAB */
00315 
00316    #ifdef EXT_ID
00317                 PRINTF("address in flash blank, setting to defined OUI and extension.\n\r");
00318                 oui_to_eui64(&eui64, OUI, EXT_ID);
00319    #else  /*ifdef EXT_ID */
00320                 PRINTF("address in flash blank, setting to defined OUI with a random extension.\n\r");
00321                 oui_to_eui64(&eui64, OUI, ((*MACA_RANDOM << 32) | *MACA_RANDOM));
00322    #endif /*endif EXTID */
00323 
00324 #endif /* ifdef IAB */
00325 
00326                 rimeaddr_copy(addr, &eui64);            
00327 #ifdef FLASH_BLANK_ADDR
00328                 PRINTF("flashing blank address\n\r");
00329                 err = nvm_write(gNvmInternalInterface_c, type, &(eui64.u8), RIMEADDR_NVM, RIMEADDR_NBYTES);             
00330 #endif /* ifdef FLASH_BLANK_ADDR */
00331         } else {
00332                 PRINTF("loading rime address from flash.\n\r");
00333         }
00334 
00335         rimeaddr_set_node_addr(addr);
00336 }
00337 
00338 int
00339 main(void)
00340 {
00341         volatile uint32_t i;
00342         rimeaddr_t addr;
00343 
00344         /* Initialize hardware and */
00345         /* go into user mode */
00346         init_lowlevel();
00347 
00348 #if STACKMONITOR
00349   /* Simple stack pointer highwater monitor. Checks for magic numbers in the main
00350    * loop. In conjuction with PERIODICPRINTS, never-used stack will be printed
00351    * every STACKMONITOR seconds.
00352    */
00353 {
00354 extern uint32_t __und_stack_top__, __sys_stack_top__;
00355 uint32_t p=(uint32_t)&__und_stack_top__;
00356     do {
00357       *(uint32_t *)p = 0x42424242;
00358       p+=16;
00359     } while (p<(uint32_t)&__sys_stack_top__-100); //don't overwrite our own stack
00360 }
00361 #endif
00362 #if HEAPMONITOR
00363   /* Simple heap pointer highwater monitor. Checks for magic numbers in the main
00364    * loop. In conjuction with PERIODICPRINTS, never-used heap will be printed
00365    * every HEAPMONITOR seconds.
00366    * This routine assumes a linear FIFO heap as used by the printf _sbrk call.
00367    */
00368 {
00369 extern uint32_t __heap_start__, __heap_end__;
00370 uint32_t p=(uint32_t)&__heap_end__-4;
00371   do {
00372      *(uint32_t *)p = 0x42424242;
00373          p-=4;
00374   } while (p>=(uint32_t)&__heap_start__);
00375 }
00376 #endif
00377 
00378         /* Clock */
00379         clock_init();   
00380 
00381         /* LED driver */
00382         leds_init();
00383 
00384         /* control TX_ON with the radio */
00385         GPIO->FUNC_SEL.GPIO_44 = 2;
00386         GPIO->PAD_DIR.GPIO_44 = 1;
00387 
00388         /* Process subsystem */
00389         process_init();
00390         process_start(&etimer_process, NULL);
00391         process_start(&contiki_maca_process, NULL);
00392 
00393         ctimer_init();
00394 
00395         set_rimeaddr(&addr);
00396 
00397         printf("Rime started with address ");
00398         for(i = 0; i < sizeof(addr.u8) - 1; i++) {
00399                 printf("%02X:", addr.u8[i]);
00400         }
00401         printf("%02X\n", addr.u8[i]);
00402 
00403 
00404 #if WITH_UIP6
00405   memcpy(&uip_lladdr.addr, &addr.u8, sizeof(uip_lladdr.addr));
00406   /* Setup nullmac-like MAC for 802.15.4 */
00407 /*   sicslowpan_init(sicslowmac_init(&cc2420_driver)); */
00408 /*   printf(" %s channel %u\n", sicslowmac_driver.name, RF_CHANNEL); */
00409 
00410   /* Setup X-MAC for 802.15.4 */
00411   queuebuf_init();
00412   NETSTACK_RDC.init();
00413   NETSTACK_MAC.init();
00414   NETSTACK_NETWORK.init();
00415 
00416   printf("%s %s, channel check rate %lu Hz, radio channel %u\n",
00417          NETSTACK_MAC.name, NETSTACK_RDC.name,
00418          CLOCK_SECOND / (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval() == 0 ? 1:
00419                          NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval()),
00420          RF_CHANNEL);
00421 
00422   process_start(&tcpip_process, NULL);
00423 
00424   printf("Tentative link-local IPv6 address ");
00425   {
00426     int i, a;
00427     for(a = 0; a < UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB; a++) {
00428       if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[a].isused) {
00429         for(i = 0; i < 7; ++i) {
00430           printf("%02x%02x:",
00431                  uip_ds6_if.addr_list[a].ipaddr.u8[i * 2],
00432                  uip_ds6_if.addr_list[a].ipaddr.u8[i * 2 + 1]);
00433         }
00434         printf("%02x%02x\n",
00435                uip_ds6_if.addr_list[a].ipaddr.u8[14],
00436                uip_ds6_if.addr_list[a].ipaddr.u8[15]);
00437       }
00438     }
00439   }
00440   
00441   if(1) {
00442     uip_ipaddr_t ipaddr;
00443     int i;
00444     uip_ip6addr(&ipaddr, 0xaaaa, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00445     uip_ds6_set_addr_iid(&ipaddr, &uip_lladdr);
00446     uip_ds6_addr_add(&ipaddr, 0, ADDR_TENTATIVE);
00447     printf("Tentative global IPv6 address ");
00448     for(i = 0; i < 7; ++i) {
00449       printf("%02x%02x:",
00450              ipaddr.u8[i * 2], ipaddr.u8[i * 2 + 1]);
00451     }
00452     printf("%02x%02x\n",
00453            ipaddr.u8[7 * 2], ipaddr.u8[7 * 2 + 1]);
00454   }
00455 
00456   
00457 #else /* WITH_UIP6 */
00458 
00459   NETSTACK_RDC.init();
00460   NETSTACK_MAC.init();
00461   NETSTACK_NETWORK.init();
00462 
00463   printf("%s %s, channel check rate %lu Hz, radio channel %u\n",
00464          NETSTACK_MAC.name, NETSTACK_RDC.name,
00465          CLOCK_SECOND / (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval() == 0? 1:
00466                          NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval()),
00467          RF_CHANNEL);
00468 #endif /* WITH_UIP6 */
00469 
00470   *MACA_MACPANID = 0xcdab; /* this is the hardcoded contiki pan, register is PACKET order */
00471   *MACA_MAC16ADDR = 0xffff; /* short addressing isn't used, set this to 0xffff for now */
00472 
00473   *MACA_MAC64HI =
00474           addr.u8[0] << 24 |
00475           addr.u8[1] << 16 |
00476           addr.u8[2] << 8 |
00477           addr.u8[3];
00478   *MACA_MAC64LO =
00479           addr.u8[4] << 24 |
00480           addr.u8[5] << 16 |
00481           addr.u8[6] << 8 |
00482           addr.u8[7];
00483   PRINTF("setting panid 0x%04x\n\r", *MACA_MACPANID);
00484   PRINTF("setting short mac 0x%04x\n\r", *MACA_MAC16ADDR);
00485   PRINTF("setting long mac 0x%08x_%08x\n\r", *MACA_MAC64HI, *MACA_MAC64LO);
00486 
00487 #if MACA_AUTOACK
00488   set_prm_mode(AUTOACK);
00489 #endif
00490 
00491 #if PROFILE_CONF_ON
00492   profile_init();
00493 #endif /* PROFILE_CONF_ON */
00494 
00495 #if TIMESYNCH_CONF_ENABLED
00496   timesynch_init();
00497   timesynch_set_authority_level(rimeaddr_node_addr.u8[0]);
00498 #endif /* TIMESYNCH_CONF_ENABLED */
00499 
00500 #if WITH_UIP
00501   process_start(&tcpip_process, NULL);
00502   process_start(&uip_fw_process, NULL); /* Start IP output */
00503   process_start(&slip_process, NULL);
00504 
00505   slip_set_input_callback(set_gateway);
00506 
00507   {
00508     uip_ipaddr_t hostaddr, netmask;
00509 
00510     uip_init();
00511 
00512     uip_ipaddr(&hostaddr, 172,16,
00513                rimeaddr_node_addr.u8[0],rimeaddr_node_addr.u8[1]);
00514     uip_ipaddr(&netmask, 255,255,0,0);
00515     uip_ipaddr_copy(&meshif.ipaddr, &hostaddr);
00516 
00517     uip_sethostaddr(&hostaddr);
00518     uip_setnetmask(&netmask);
00519     uip_over_mesh_set_net(&hostaddr, &netmask);
00520     /*    uip_fw_register(&slipif);*/
00521     uip_over_mesh_set_gateway_netif(&slipif);
00522     uip_fw_default(&meshif);
00523     uip_over_mesh_init(UIP_OVER_MESH_CHANNEL);
00524     printf("uIP started with IP address %d.%d.%d.%d\n",
00525            uip_ipaddr_to_quad(&hostaddr));
00526   }
00527 #endif /* WITH_UIP */
00528 
00529   process_start(&sensors_process, NULL);
00530   
00531   print_processes(autostart_processes);
00532   autostart_start(autostart_processes);
00533  
00534   /* Main scheduler loop */
00535   while(1) {
00536           check_maca();
00537 
00538 #if (USE_WDT == 1)
00539           cop_service();
00540 #endif
00541 
00542           if(uart1_input_handler != NULL) {
00543                   if(uart1_can_get()) {
00544                           uart1_input_handler(uart1_getc());
00545                   }
00546           }
00547                  
00548           process_run();
00549 
00550 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00551 #if TESTRTIMER
00552 /* Timeout can be increased up to 8 seconds maximum.
00553  * A one second cycle is convenient for triggering the various debug printouts.
00554  * The triggers are staggered to avoid printing everything at once.
00555  */
00556     if (rtimerflag) {
00557       rtimer_set(&rt, RTIMER_NOW()+ RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND*1UL, 1,(void *) rtimercycle, NULL);
00558       rtimerflag=0;
00559 #else
00560   if (clocktime!=clock_seconds()) {
00561      clocktime=clock_seconds();
00562 #endif
00563 
00564 #if STAMPS
00565 if ((clocktime%STAMPS)==0) {
00566 #if ENERGEST_CONF_ON
00567 #include "lib/print-stats.h"
00568         print_stats();
00569 #elif RADIOSTATS
00570 extern volatile unsigned long radioontime;
00571   printf("\r%u(%u)s ",clocktime,radioontime);
00572 #else
00573   printf("%us\n",clocktime);
00574 #endif
00575 
00576 }
00577 #endif
00578 #if TESTRTIMER
00579       clocktime+=1;
00580 #endif
00581 
00582 #if PINGS && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00583 extern void raven_ping6(void); 
00584 if ((clocktime%PINGS)==1) {
00585   printf("**Ping\n");
00586   raven_ping6();
00587 }
00588 #endif
00589 
00590 #if ROUTES && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00591 if ((clocktime%ROUTES)==2) {
00592       
00593 extern uip_ds6_nbr_t uip_ds6_nbr_cache[];
00594 extern uip_ds6_route_t uip_ds6_routing_table[];
00595 extern uip_ds6_netif_t uip_ds6_if;
00596 
00597   uint8_t i,j;
00598   printf("\nAddresses [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB);
00599   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00600     if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {
00601       uip_debug_ipaddr_print(&uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr);
00602       printf("\n");
00603     }
00604   }
00605   printf("\nNeighbors [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_NBR_NB);
00606   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_NBR_NB; i++) {
00607     if(uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].isused) {
00608       uip_debug_ipaddr_print(&uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].ipaddr);
00609       printf("\n");
00610       j=0;
00611     }
00612   }
00613   if (j) printf("  <none>");
00614   printf("\nRoutes [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB);
00615   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB; i++) {
00616     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].isused) {
00617       uip_debug_ipaddr_print(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].ipaddr);
00618       printf("/%u (via ", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].length);
00619       uip_debug_ipaddr_print(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].nexthop);
00620  //     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime < 600) {
00621         printf(") %lus\n", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime);
00622  //     } else {
00623  //       printf(")\n");
00624  //     }
00625       j=0;
00626     }
00627   }
00628   if (j) printf("  <none>");
00629   printf("\n---------\n");
00630 }
00631 #endif
00632 
00633 #if STACKMONITOR
00634 if ((clocktime%STACKMONITOR)==3) {
00635 extern uint32_t __und_stack_top__, __sys_stack_top__;
00636 uint32_t p=(uint32_t)&__und_stack_top__;
00637   do {
00638     if (*(uint32_t *)p != 0x42424242) {
00639       printf("Never-Used stack > %d bytes\n",p-(uint32_t)&__und_stack_top__);
00640       break;
00641     }
00642     p+=16;
00643   } while (p<(uint32_t)&__sys_stack_top__-100);
00644 }
00645 #endif
00646 #if HEAPMONITOR
00647 if ((clocktime%HEAPMONITOR)==4) {
00648 extern uint32_t __heap_start__, __heap_end__;
00649 uint32_t p=(uint32_t)&__heap_end__-4;
00650   do {
00651     if (*(uint32_t *)p != 0x42424242) {
00652       break;
00653     }
00654     p-=4;
00655   } while (p>=(uint32_t)&__heap_start__);
00656   printf("Never-used heap >= %d bytes\n",(uint32_t)&__heap_end__-p-4);
00657 #if 0
00658 #include <stdlib.h>
00659 char *ptr=malloc(1);  //allocates 16 bytes from the heap
00660 printf("********Got pointer %x\n",ptr);
00661 #endif
00662 }
00663 #endif
00664 
00665     }
00666 #endif /* PERIODICPRINTS */
00667   }
00668   
00669   return 0;
00670 }

00673 #if LOG_CONF_ENABLED
00674 void
00675 log_message(char *m1, char *m2)
00676 {
00677   printf("%s%s\n", m1, m2);
00678 }
00679 #endif /* LOG_CONF_ENABLED */
